Trial_Design.evidence: patients at high risk of postoperative AF scheduled to undergo major thoracic surgery were randomized

Participants.evidence: patients at high risk of postoperative AF scheduled to undergo major thoracic surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomized to N-acetylcysteine plus amiodarone or placebo plus amiodarone

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that N-acetylcysteine mitigates inflammation and oxidative stress to reduce the incidence of postoperative AF.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was sustained AF >30 s by telemetry (first 72 h) or symptoms requiring intervention and confirmed by ECG within 7 days of surgery.

Number_Analysed.evidence: postoperative AF occurred in 15 of 78 who received N-acetylcysteine (19%) and 13 of 76 who received placebo (17%)
